meanings.definition: A person who crosses something, such as a street or border.
meanings.sent1: The crossers waited patiently at the pedestrian crossing.
meanings.sent2: The border patrol stopped the illegal crossers from entering the country.
meanings.sent3: The crossers at the zebra crossing were in a hurry to reach the other side.
meanings.sent4: The crossers of the finish line celebrated their victory.
meanings.sent5: The brave crossers crossed the river on a shaky bridge.

meanings.definition: A line or mark that intersects another line or mark.
meanings.sent1: The two crossers on the graph met at the intersection point.
meanings.sent2: The crossers on the map indicated where the roads intersected.
meanings.sent3: The crossers on the paper seemed to dance together.
meanings.sent4: The crossers of the lines created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The crossers of the paths led to a hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: A type of stitch used in embroidery.
meanings.sent1: The intricate design was created using crossers in the embroidery.
meanings.sent2: The crossers added a lovely texture to the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous crossers in the sewing kit always tangled up.
meanings.sent4: The crossers of the thread formed a delicate flower.
meanings.sent5: The skilled artist used crossers to embellish the pattern.
